headline: NPR mocked for article on 'white privilege' emojis
author: Lindsay Kornick
sentences: The answer can be more complex than you think," claimed that white people using the common yellow-handed, thumbs-up emoji can actually suggest ignorance of white privilege.
NPR was ridiculed on Wednesday for its take on emojis and how some can supposedly denote white privilege.
Many people of color have to do that every day and are confronted with race every day,"
Its authors were Alejandra Marquez Jans, Asma Khalid and Patrick Jarenwattananon.
"I completely hear some people are just exhausted [from] having to do that.
The article, headlined "Which skin color emoji should you use?
